paper_metadata.title: Family Stress Model analysis of integrated poverty reduction intervention impact on child mental health in Burkina Faso

program_information.target_population: Vulnerable families with children aged 10-15 and their female caregivers
program_information.program_name_citation: Participants were randomized into a control arm, economic intervention using the Graduation approach (Treatment Arm 1), or a combination of economic strengthening and family coaching (Treatment Arm 2)
program_information.country_citation: Longitudinal data were collected over the course of 24 months in a cluster-randomized controlled trial conducted among 360 dyads (children aged 10e15 and their female caregivers) in Burkina Faso
program_information.target_population_citation: Longitudinal data were collected over the course of 24 months in a cluster-randomized controlled trial conducted among 360 dyads (children aged 10e15 and their female caregivers) in Burkina Faso

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: economic intervention using the Graduation approach (Treatment Arm 1), or a combination of economic strengthening and family coaching (Treatment Arm 2)

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: economic intervention using the Graduation approach (Treatment Arm 1)

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Cross-lagged autoregressive longitudinal mediation analyses tested the intervention effect on child mental health, examining maternal depression, maternal anxiety, harsh parenting, and child exposure to abuse as potential mediators
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: cluster-randomized controlled trial conducted among 360 dyads
